titlestmt.titleproper: Levi White Letters To Lucy White 1863-1865
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by MarcEdit
titlestmt.sponsor: Conversion of this record was made possible by a grant from the National Historic Publications and Records Commission, an agency of the U.S. National Archives and Records Administration.

publicationstmt.publisher: Oregon Historical Society Davies Family Research Library

profiledesc.descrules: Finding aid based on DACS ( Describing Archives: A Content Standard)

address.addressline: Oregon Historical Society Davies Family Research Library

did.unittitle: Levi White letters to Lucy White
did.abstract: Letters from Levi White to his wife, Lucy, 2 pp, 1863 and 1865, regarding Civil War battles in which White was involved, wounds, his health, hospital conditions and relating that White captured a rebel flag in battle on 31 March 1865. Born in New York in 1838, Levi White, Sr. moved to Roseburg, Oregon in 1899.

bioghist.p: Born in New York in 1838, Levi White, Sr. moved to Roseburg, Oregon in 1899.

scopecontent.p: Letters from Levi White to his wife, Lucy, 2 pp, 1863 and 1865, regarding Civil War battles in which White was involved, wounds, his health, hospital conditions and relating that White captured a rebel flag in battle on 31 March 1865.

acqinfo.p: Gift of Mr. and Mrs. George White, April 1987.

accessrestrict.p: This collection is open to the public.

userestrict.p: The Oregon Historical Society is the owner of the materials in the Research Library and makes available reproductions for research, publication, and other uses. Written permission must be obtained from the Research Library prior to any use of reproductions. The Society does not necessarily hold copyright to all the materials in the collections. In some cases, permission for use of reproductions may require seeking additional authorization from the copyright holders.

prefercite.p: Levi White letters to Lucy White, Mss 1500, Oregon Historical Society Research Library.
